author: Alexander Belyaev
title: Lord of the World
description: A science fiction novel exploring themes of utopia, dystopia, and the consequences of technological advancement.

author: Aleksandr Volkov
title: Wizard of the Emerald City
description: A children's fantasy novel inspired by L. Frank Baum's Wizard of Oz series, set in the magical land of Magic Land.

author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist
description: An allegorical novel about a young Andalusian shepherd who sets out to discover his personal legend and find treasure.

author: Harry Harrison
title: Invasion
description: A science fiction novel depicting humanity's struggle against an alien invasion and its aftermath.

author: Alexander Belyaev
title: Professor Dowell's Head
description: A science fiction novel exploring the consequences of a scientist's experiment to transplant a living human head onto another body.

author: Robert Kiyosaki
title: Rich Dad, Poor Dad
description: A personal finance book discussing the differences in mindset between the author's 'rich dad' and 'poor dad'.

author: Tologon Kasymbekov
title: Broken Sword
description: A historical novel set in Central Asia during the time of the Russian conquests, focusing on the clash of cultures and the struggles of the Kazakh people.

author: Mukay Elebayev
title: Long Haul
description: Mukai Elebaev made a significant innovation in Kyrgyz literature in the 30s of the last century by writing the novel “Uzak Zhol”. With this first novel, he suddenly raised national prose to a professional level. The novel vividly describes the terrible tragic face of Urkun in 1916, the result of the hardships of the tsarist colonialists, and the fate of the people who fled to China.

author: Aaly Tokombayev
title: Bloody Years
description: A historical novel set during the turbulent times of political upheaval in Kyrgyzstan, exploring themes of power, corruption, and revolution.

author: Joanne Rowling
title: Harry Potter
description: A fantasy series following the life and adventures of a young wizard, Harry Potter, and his friends as they battle the dark wizard Voldemort.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A philosophical novel about a young man named Dorian Gray who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty, leading to moral corruption and tragedy.

author: Alexander Pushkin
title: Dubrovsky
description: A romantic novel following the story of a nobleman who seeks revenge for the wrongs done to his family, taking on the guise of a bandit.
